G.BigWinCommand.name: G.BigWinCommand
G.BigWinCommand.description: Command will remove a playing big win animation

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
Commands contain the methods init, and execute.
Commands can be added to a CommandQueue once initialised with any necessary data, when added to a CommandQueue, commands' execute
function is called when the command is reached in the queue. The command's callNextDelay defines how many millis until the next
command may be called.

CommandQueue.name: CommandQueue
CommandQueue.description:
Based on the Command Pattern, a CommandQueue consists of an array of commands (the queue)
And methods to play, pause, loop and flush the current queue.
When set to play, the commandQueue will execute each command in the queue, then wait a period of time defined
in the command, before executing the next command.
Command Queues support infinite looping: when a loopIndex is found inside a command, it will loop back to this command when the queue has finished.

CustomCommand.name: CustomCommand
CustomCommand.description: For testing functionality inside a command queue.. put what you want in one of these

FireworksCommand.name: FireworksCommand
FireworksCommand.description: Command responsible for launching a 'Firework' particle animation.
todo: remove shouldStopExisting functionality
component should only handle it based on animationDuration.

SymbolAnimCommand.name: SymbolAnimCommand
SymbolAnimCommand.description: Command responsible for playing Symbol Animations on the SymbolWinsComponent

WinLineCommand.name: WinLineCommand
WinLineCommand.description:
This command has a dual purpose, so it's important to read the init function arguments correctly.
Firstly, the command can show multiple Winlines (may rename to Payline as that is the name used by server).
In this case, pass an array of all the paylineIndexes to the init function.
Secondly the command can show a single payline, in that case pass an array containing only 1 payline index in the array.

If only one payline is being shown, we might want to animate some symbols with a square win box around it.
To do this, either pass a frameLabel, or an array of frameLabels for mixed animations

BigWinComponent.name: BigWinComponent
BigWinComponent.description: This component is reponsible for drawing the sprites which will play the big win animations

Dj.name: Dj
Dj.description: Dj controls sound. Sound begin, end, etc...

GaffeMenuComponent.name: GaffeMenuComponent
GaffeMenuComponent.description:
A GaffeMenu component which you can call show/hide from to show and hide the menu
should also draw some buttons based on setup.json's gaffes

GameComponent.name: GameComponent
GameComponent.description:
Super class of any game component.  These game components are always initialised with the game's setup file and a signal dispatcher.
This allows all game components (eg. ReelsComponent or WinLinesComponent) to access game setup and dispatch and receive events from other
areas of the application

MeterComponent.name: MeterComponent
MeterComponent.description:
The MeterComponent currently contains only the balance textfield
Future stake selector, pay lines selector should be added to this also.

ParticlesComponent.name: ParticlesComponent
ParticlesComponent.description:
Game component handling all particle animations
Particle Animations are currently built using Proton.  It's a flexible particle system, chosen for it's
multiple render mode support (supports Pixi.js and createjs, WebGL and others).
Initial benchmarks prove the system animates very smoothly across devices, providing built animations operate within
sensible thresholds and cleared up properly.

Reel.name: Reel
Reel.description:
One Reel defined by this class. Contains a sprite map for mapping sprite ids to symbol sprites.
Sets up and executes the spin animation Tween when reels are spun.
Stops the tween when spinning is ended and signals to the ReelComponent.

ReelsComponent.name: ReelsComponent
ReelsComponent.description:
GameComponent responsible for creating the G.Reels (ReelStrips) drawing symbols to each reel and launching the spin animation on them.
This class makes spinRequests via the serverInterface, and handles the responses by updating the reels according the to the
stops array.
It also dispatches a signalDispatcher.reelSpinComplete signal when all reel animations have completed

SymbolWinsComponent.name: SymbolWinsComponent
SymbolWinsComponent.description:
This GameComponent is responsible for showing and hiding symbol animations.
SpriteSheet driven animations are stored as 2D Array (symbolsMatrix), 1st level of the array represents each reel
and this reel array stores a sprite for each visible symbol on that reel.
Sprites are arranged over each visible symbol.
Playing and Hiding of animations is normally called via the G.SymbolAnimCommand
(although anims are played during slow init caching and debugging purposes)

WinLine.name: WinLine
WinLine.description:
Responsible for drawing a winLine dynamically.
Many of these are drawn and cached inside WinLinesComponent, which shows and hides these winLines as required.

Game.name: Game
Game.description:
Game is the root of the application.  It creates everything a king kong game needs in order to run.  And is responsible for initialising
Preloading, SignalDispatcher, Server connection, GameData, GameComponents and the Display.  Scaling and UserInterface Events are also handled here.
It also provides some dependency injection to the Games Components, which becomes the core method GameComponents use to talk to each other.

Responsibilities explained:

Preloading: Creates and initialises a G.Preloader which goes and fetches required sound and graphic assets.

Server: Creates and initialises a G.ServerInterface which can talk to the server. (Currently the Node server for development purposes).

Signals: We use signalsjs to handle communications around the application.  Signals are test friendly, and robust event dispatching system which don't rely on
"magic" strings to work.  They also support custom parameters, which gets rid of the need to create custom event classes.
We use a signalDispatcher object passed into GameComponents to handle communication between different components.

GameComponents: The app contains a number of gameComponents.  A GameComponent is a createjs.Container, a DisplayObject which may be added to the canvas.
They may also contains some game logic, for example: the reels must be displayed according the margin values passed in via the setup.json.
Also, a reel may animate and dispatch an event(signal) when completed.
For this reason all GameComponents are passed references to the setup.j	son and a SignalDispatcher.
All GameComponents are also added to the static G.Utils.gameComponents array, which gives the application the freedom to call up gameComponents at any time when
required without necessarily having to use the signalDispatcher.

GameData: Creates and initialises a G.GameData.  When data is returned from the server, it uses GameData to store the returned responses and notify the signalDispatcher
that data has returned.

Stage and Ticker: Stage and Ticker are createjs concepts.  Stage is the root display object of the Canvas, and is the container where all createjs display objects
must be added to.  Ticker is responsible for updating the stage at regular intervals.  We currently sync stage updates with requestAnimationFrame
in order to ensure that animations are as smooth as possible on newer browsers which support requestAnimationFrame.
It is recommened to read this to understand more: http://createjs.com/tutorials/Animation%20and%20Ticker/

See more info at: http://createjs.com/Home

Proton: Is particle animation system used by this application - It was chosen because it supports createjs and other rendering engines.
It also performed very well in tests. It is created here in Game because it is required to be updated during the createjs.Ticker cycle.

See more info at:  https://github.com/a-jie/Proton

Scaling: In order to support multiple screen resolutions, the application is created at a native scale size of 667px x 375px.
This value should be set as the setup.json's "scale" value.
The application supports multiple scale modes to help support as many device sizes as possible:
	"FULL_ASPECT":
		This scales the application up or down to fit into the the devices viewport while maintaining aspect ratio.  Viewport is the window size, and iframe or WebView container size should be respected.
	"FULL_BROWSER":
		This scales the application up or down to fit into the viewport dimensions precisely.  This will cause stretching on devices that don't match the native aspect
		ratio.
	"NONE" or any other value:
		No scaling is performed, and the application is created at the native dimensions.


Devices:
This application is designed to play on multiple devices, browsers and screen resolutions.  Having said this, it is not possible to design
an application which can run on any browser on any device and on any screen size. There are limitations and these should be considered.
todo: create a device compatiibility matrix

GameData.name: GameData
GameData.description:
GameData is our server model.
It is mainly used by the ServerInterface to store returned server data.
It also dispatches signals to notify GameComponents that some server data has returned.
eg. ReelsComponent is notified when a slotResponse has been received in order to start the Reel spin animation.

Preloader.name: Preloader
Preloader.description:
Responsible for loading setup.json config file, then sound and graphic assets.
These include, spritesheets, and data in the form of json files
It will then dispatch signals back to the Game for notification and safe caching of assets.
Currently uses PreloadJS - see http://createjs.com/Docs/PreloadJS/modules/PreloadJS.html

ServerInterface.name: ServerInterface
ServerInterface.description:
Makes calls to the Server and receives messages.  This class is passed to GameComponents which rely on user interaction that needs to notify the server.
GameComponents which require to be notified of incoming server messages, should be passed the GameData Class and listen to signals dispatched from it.
When plugging the application to an ElectoTank (or any other) Server, this is the only class which should need to change.
uses: Fetch - https://github.com/github/fetch a cross browser polyfill for making REST api calls.

SignalDispatcher.name: SignalDispatcher
SignalDispatcher.description:
Central Hub for providing Signals for the app to dispatch and listen to.
Signal Dispatcher is the core communication component of the application.  Ensure it is passed into any Class which might need to talk to another.
In this context we can listen to gameData signals, and have the signalDispatcher dispatch a signal which can be listened to by GameComponents which require
to be notified when some server data has been received.  Eg. ReelsComponent can spin the reels when a spin response is received.

SpinEvaluator.name: SpinEvaluator
SpinEvaluator.description:
This class is designed to handle spin responses, evaluate any win condition,
and call any win animations necessary.

QueueFactory.name: QueueFactory
QueueFactory.description: Constructs queues for the CommandQueue for the purpose of displaying winning animations

Utils.name: Utils
Utils.description:
Utility methods and properties commonly used around the application.
GameComponents are stored here.
Canvas scale is stored here.
Please be aware that application code has global access to this class, because it is static. So don't go crazy.

Main.name: Main
Main.description:
This is the main application entry point.
Main is instantiated by the index.html and it's init function called when the web application dependencies are fully loaded.
No other entry points should be used by the index.html

classitems.description:
Defines the big win animation type to play

- 3: 3x3 big win
- 4: 3x4 big win
- 5: 3x5 big win

classitems.description:
If array of frameLabels defined, then play a mixed set of symbol animations.
If the length of this array is greater than numSquares, then the exceeding labels won't play any anim.
classitems.name: frameLabels
example: ["m2", "m1", "m3", "m1", "m1"] would play at this paylineindex: m2, m1, m3, m1, m1 symbol animations in that order.

classitems.description: pass true as the last argument to the init function to have the SymbolWinsComponent auto append its suffix to the fameLabel.
todo: use this always
and remove the need to change it.

params.description: - array indexes of winLines based on setup.winLines which we'd like to show

params.name: numSquares
params.description: - number of win squares to display on win line (with animation if frameLabel(s) defined)

params.name: frameLabel
params.description: - optional - play a symbol animation on this payline

params.name: frameLabels
params.description:
- optional - array of frameLabels, play mixed animations on this payline
index.  This is an array so you can play different symbol animations on one payline.  This currently  will only work if
the paylineIndexes array has length 1.

params.name: autoAppendSuffix
params.description: - set to true if you'd like to automatically append the suffix set in SymbolWinsComponent to the frameLabel.

todo: implement blinking symbol animations in instances where framelabel can't be found in the sprite animations

classitems.description:
Hide Previously drawn winLines and show more winLines.
optionally play some symbol animations on the payline(s).  If the command was initted with a playAnimId, then play the same animation across the pay line
If the command was initted with frameLabels array, play a mixed set of symbol animations across the pay line.
classitems.name: execute
todo: simplify this command by always calling init with framelabels array.
make paylineIndexes array optional (pass a single payline index to show one payline).

classitems.description:
initialises the gameComponent by wiring setup and signalDispatcher
Also pushes this instance to the Utils.gameComponents array.
Once initialised, this gameComponent may be called by calling the static
getGameComponentByClass method eg: G.Utils.getGameComponentByClass(G.ReelsComponent);
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Once a component is initialised correctly, it's display object are ready to be drawn (added) to the stage object
Do this by calling this function.
classitems.name: drawComponent

classitems.description:
Some Vector drawn assets, and Bitmap sprite animations should be played during app initialisation to ensure they are ready to run at runtime.
Call this function once this process is completed, and it will signal to the game that this component's drawing/anim is ready to play.
For Vectors, call this after Vector drawing is done.
For Bitmap sprites, make sure that it's animations have played once then call this.
When adding a component requiring this type of caching, you must add 1 to the Game's initailisedNum.
nb. Caching only takes place when setup.json's failSafeDelay is used.
classitems.name: cacheComplete

If reelData has been modified then schedule this function on during the first spin 'loop'.

classitems.name: updateSymbolSprites

classitems.description:
Draws a ReelStrip of symbols based on slotInit.reelStrips indexes and setup.json symbol.frameLabels.
Replacement symbols are derived from setup.json, and if either the index or the label are matching, then replace the symbol sprite image
with the defaultReplacementLabel
debugging sprites are drawn if setup.json activates "devMode":1
Each reelStrip draws a set (wrap) of symbols twice to allow for speedy reelAnimation looping without missing symbols
A buffer (n number of symbols - configurable) is also drawn above and below the 2 wraps to allow for elastic bounce easing on spin animations and to facilitate
the spin animation.

The fullset of slotInit.reelstips is not drawn here, as animating 90+ symbols in a reelstrip is very laggy
So during init, a 10 cut version of the reelStrips iss created.
classitems.name: drawReel

classitems.description: Spin this reel to the specified index position with a given delay
classitems.name: spinToIndex

params.name: index
params.description: - index of symbol on this reel to spin to (top left of reel should spin to this index)

params.name: delay
params.description: - Millis til this spin will start

classitems.description: Returns the time required to tween this reel through a set of this.reelData.length symbols
classitems.name: getTime

classitems.description: Begins a new loop of spinning animation beginning at this.y 0 and ending at the end of 1 set of symbols
classitems.name: loopSpin

classitems.description: Returns the time required for the stop tween animation (from this.y 0 to the symbol stop index). Uses number of pixels as the distance
classitems.name: getStopTime

params.name: index
params.description: - the symbol index the tween animation is going to stop at

classitems.description:
Tweens this reelStrip to the y position of the spinResultIndex
Schedules a reelStop sound via playSound signal
Calls handleSpinComplete on when tween is finished.
classitems.name: stopSpinTween

classitems.description: For debugging spin animation purposes
classitems.name: onYPosUpdate

classitems.description: Manually stops the current spin animation - also called automatically by the stopTimeout.
classitems.name: fastStop

classitems.description: Dispatches the reelSpinEnd signal when the reel spin animation is completed.
classitems.name: handleSpinComplete

classitems.description:
Modify the spin speed percentage value (accepts 0-100%);
Reels will spin at this perecentage of the speedConstant in pixels per second.
classitems.name: spinSpeedIncrement

classitems.description:
the createjs spritesheet data object required to pass to the createjs.SpriteSheet constructor in order to draw the symbols.
This is passed from Game during initialisation.
classitems.name: symbolSprites

classitems.description:
These are the default symbols drawn to the reels.
This may need to be created from the slotInit response at some point.
classitems.name: reelsData

classitems.description: Container for the G.Reel sub components, 1 per reel.
classitems.name: reels

classitems.description:
Setup contains a map array of all the symbol names. eg. 'ww', 'm1'. These are stored in the array at the index of the symbolId.
That way we can draw the correct symbols according to reelStrips data array, which is an array of symbolIds.
classitems.name: reelMap

classitems.description:
Keeps a count of the number of reels which are currenlty animating.  When a reel dispatches it's complete signal, this number is
reduced.  When the number of reels spinning becomes 0 this component can fire it's reelsSpinComplete signal via the signalDispatcher.
classitems.name: reelsSpinning

classitems.description:
If a spinRequest has been made to the server we do not want to make another spin request.  Instead, we would like
to hammer the reels to stop.
classitems.name: spinRequested

classitems.description: The ServerInterface is required here to make spin Requests.
classitems.name: serverInterface

classitems.description:
This stores the last spin, and is dispatched with the reel complete
to allow SignalDispatcher to evaluate any wins.
initialises the reelsComponent with required game data and assets
classitems.name: init

params.name: setup
params.description: - the setup json data object

params.name: signalDispatcher
params.description: - game's signal dispatcher used to dispatch signals to the rest of the application

params.name: serverInterface
params.description: - reference to the game's server interface required to make the spin request

params.name: symbolSprites
params.description: - the createjs spritesheet data object required to pass to the createjs.SpriteSheet constructor

params.name: slotInitResponse
params.description: - the slot init response from the server.

classitems.description:
This function is necessary because the reelStrips arrays are so large, the spin animation cannot cope with animating such a
large amount of symbols in one strip without serious lag (I've tried it!)
(It's possible a blitted approach may get around this issue)
For now the initial reelStrips are made up of n symbols cut from the reelStrips array during initialisation (n = setup.json variable cutLength)
So we just take a slice from the initial stop value of the array and return the new reelStrips 2d array which we'll use to draw the reel symbols from.
classitems.name: getInitialStrips
todo: make stop value dynamic and set it to the initialStops inside slotInit

classitems.description:
Takes an array of symbol ID's and passes them to each reel to modify symbol sprites at runtime on each reel
This is usually only done when the spin request server response has returned the stop positions, but can also be used
for calling and debugging win animations.
classitems.name: modifySymbolData

classitems.description: Creates and initialises each reelstrip, and draws them to the display.
classitems.name: drawReels

classitems.description:
Gaffe spin requests handled by reelsComponent so that it knows a spin has been requested.
Calls ServerInterface to make an api request for the gaffe (requestUrl)
classitems.name: handleGaffSpinRequest

classitems.description:
requestSpin is called every time the user initiates a spin (either via the keyboard or swipe to spin gesture on touch devices)
If spinRequest has not yet been made (ie the reels are stopped) then this makes a serverInterface.requestSpin call, and the spinRequest flag
is set to true.
Otherwise we slam the reels to stop them.
todo: : the duration of time after spinning before a user can slam the reels need to be configurable via the setup file
as some regions require a cool-down period between spins.
classitems.name: requestSpin

classitems.description:
Reel Animations start here: configuration options are in setup.reelAnimation
- 1. By default 10 symbols after and including the symbol at the stopIndex of the reelStrip are cut from the reelStrips array
- 2. Existing symbols on the reels are switched to those symbols.  Switching takes place off the visible canvas after the first spin cycle,
to give the existing symbols time to animate from the reels.
- 3. If a symbolIndex in the reelStrip array equals the replacementId defined in the setup.json then a replacement is made based on the spinResponse.
- 4. Starts the reels spinning and passes the correct symbol index to stop to
See (G.Reel) for more info about how reel strips are drawn and animated.
classitems.name: serverSpinStart

params.name: spinResponse
params.description: - the spin response containing the spinRecords and stops array

todo: support a spinResponse which contains multiple spin records

classitems.description:
Spins all reels with a delay configuration from setup.json
Stops reels if they are currently spinning.
Clear any winline/animation overlays
Play Spin Sound
classitems.name: spinReels

classitems.description: Schedules the reels to stop immediately
classitems.name: slamSpin

classitems.description:
Signal handler called when reel.reelSpinEnd is dispatched.  When all reels have finished
this method dispatches the signalDispatcher.reelSpinComplete signal.

classitems.description: the spritesheet data for symbol win animations loaded by Preloader

classitems.description: Scale the symbols by this amount, determined by the scale reduction (n) used in Texturepacker to the ratio 1/n

example: - [1, 1 , 1, 0, 0] to draw winning symbol border boxes in the first 3 then a line in the final 2 [] [] [] - -

classitems.description: Store data required to locate the win line on the reel

classitems.usage: 0 = top symbol, 1 = middle symbol, 2 = bottom symbol on a 3 line reel.  For greater visible reel height just increase the number
example: - [0,0,0,1,2] would draw the line along the top row of the first 3 reels, then it would go through the next row and the last row in the final reel

classitems.description:
Decides what scale mode is used to determine the scale and position of the canvas
this value is overridden by whatever value is inside setup.json 'scale'
classitems.name: STAGE_SCALE_MODE
example: "NO_SCALE" - uses the default setup.json stageScale value;
"FULL_BROWSER" - stretches the app to the viewport size;
classitems.default: 'FULL_ASPECT - scales the app to the viewport, maintining aspect ratio'

classitems.description: Displayed in gaffeMenu - version is injected by the build process.

classitems.description:
This is the main setup file for the application.  Many properties and features in the app can be enabled / disabled via this configuration.
The first thing Game does is look for the setup.json in the default directory and try to load it.  Once loaded it sets this property from the loaded
json object.
classitems.name: setup

classitems.description:
This is created during init and talks to the server.  It is used by GameComponents to make requests to the server.
Responses are delivered to the GameComponents via signalDispatcher.
classitems.name: serverInterface

classitems.description:
This is created during init and passed around the application to GameComponents, or any part of the application that requires to talk or listen to another part.
Signals created on this object can be dispatched and handled by any class which has this reference.
classitems.name: signalDispatcher

classitems.description: SpinEvaluator listens to the reelComplete signal, and prepares win animations based on any wins in the spinResponse.

Object contains references to assets loaded via preloader.
This can then be used to pass to GameComponents which require loaded assets.

GameData stores data returned from the server via ServerInterface requests
It can dispatch signalDispatcher signals to notify GameComponents some serverResponse has happened.

Number of initialised game components to check have initialised before loader is removed.  If the setup.json defines
failSafeDelay then it waits for Reels, WinLines and BigWin Animation to play before it removes the preloader
classitems.name: initialisedNum

classitems.description: Caches the preloader HTML element which covers the app during loading and initialisation

classitems.name: canvas

classitems.description: Command Queue for winAnimations - based on the Command design pattern.
classitems.name: commandQueue;

classitems.description: Set to true when all game and core components have been initialised are available
classitems.name: gameInitComplete

classitems.description:
Game initialisation - it all starts here

Creates and initialises Game framework classes in this order:
0. Init Utils.params
1. Stats
2. SignalDispatcher
3. GameData
4. ServerInterface
5. Stage
6. Proton

Game initialisation is continued when the ServerInterface returns SlotInitResponse
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
When Slot Init is Received, then Preloader is created and setup.json begins loading
App then waits for assetsLoadComplete signal to be dispatched by preloader.
Preloader element is cached so it can be removed later.
classitems.name: slotInitReceived

classitems.description: SignalHandler which caches setup.json object when it has finished loading.
classitems.name: onSetupLoaded

params.name: setup
params.description: - Setup Object which is loaded from setup.json file

classitems.description:
Signal Handler called when assetsLoadComplete is dispatched by preloader.
Assets are cached and the application continues to initialisation phase.
1. Rescale the application according the setup.json config,
2. Setup the main display, creates GameComponents and adds them to the stage.
3. Proton animation system is created.
classitems.name: onAssetsLoadComplete

params.name: assets
params.description: - the preloaded game assets which are cached and passed to GameComponents which need it.

classitems.description:
Scales Application according to setup.json scaling configuration

AVAILABLE STAGE_SCALE_MODE = "FULL ASPECT" || "FULL_BROWSER" || "NO_SCALE" or ANY OTHER VALUE
"FULL_ASPECT" - scale the application to the visible window size, whilst maintaining the app's native apsect ratio.  This will display black borders
when a devices apsect ratio doesn't match the app's.
"FULL_BROWSER" - scale the application to fit the entire window size, stretching the graphics if the aspect ratios do not match.
"NO_SCALE" - do not scale the application at all.

If the setup.json's enableDesktopView is turned on, the app is set automatically to not scale.
Stores the final scale value inside G.Utils, for access anywhere in the application.
classitems.name: rescale

classitems.description:
Initialise and create GaemComponents and add them to the display.
Adds stats to the window for profiling
Masks the reels inside the bezel area.

nb. These are potentially expensive cpu operations, but everything done here is done after Preload and during app initialisation.
Any filters applied to display objects will magnify the length of time this function takes to complete.
classitems.name: setupDisplay

classitems.description:
Application wiring is done here
Application communitcation:
GameComponents talk to each other by dispatching and handling Signals
Core components also use the signal dispatcher.
EG. Spin Evaluator listens to the reelComplete signal and prepares a CommandQueue (for win animations).
classitems.name: wireApp

When initialisedNum has reduced to 0, all game components requiring async initialisation and graphics caching has completed
and the preloader element is removed from the dom.

feature

71   = G           - GAFFEE MENU
70   = F

classitems.description:
init method stores passed in signalDispatcher and gameData.
Signals which need to be handled by GameComponents should also be declared here.

use the signalDispatcher
A slotInitCompleted signal is then dispatched

params.name: json
params.description: - the slotInit response from the server

classitems.name: spinResponse

params.name: json
params.description: - the spinResponse from the server

classitems.description: URL location where the Preloader can find the config file (setup.json)
classitems.constant: SETUP_URL - path of setup.json file relative to public root.

classitems.description:
The load queue which will load configuration files.
Currently only loading the setup.json file, but any future configuration eg. language file could be added to this load queue.
classitems.name: setupLoader

classitems.description:
The load queue which will load game assets, like sounds, spritesheets and other images.
Currently there seems to be some unexpected behaviour where spritesheet image file loading is completed after the assetLoader.complete event is fired,
leading to premature application initiation.  This has been raised with the PreloadJS team and the issue can be followed here: https://github.com/CreateJS/PreloadJS/issues/129
In the meantime we are separately loading the spritesheet.pngs via the loader to ensure they are loaded before our preloader element is removed.
The drawback of this is that the spritesheet.pngs get preloaded AND loaded after the app is initialised.  Although the 2nd load will likely be from cache.
classitems.name: assetsLoader

classitems.description: When the setupLoader complete event is fired, this signal is dispatched notifying the Game.
classitems.name: setupComplete

classitems.description: When the assetsLoader complete event is fired, this signal is dispatched notifying the Game, and loaded assets passed with it.
classitems.name: assetsLoaded

classitems.description: The loaded config file (setup.json).
classitems.name: setup

classitems.description: The HTML element displaying preloader information
classitems.name: progressEl

classitems.description:
Preloader initialisation sets up the following:

- Set up LoadQueue for loading config file (setup.json).
- Set up LoadQueue for loading game assets (sounds, spritesheets more jsons)
- Set up EventHandlers to listen for LoadQueue events.
- Install the SoundJS Plugin
Starts the setupLoader load queue.
classitems.name: startLoad

classitems.name: handleSetupLoaded

params.name: e

classitems.name: handleAssetsError

params.name: e
params.description: - The error event.

classitems.description: handle progress of game assets
classitems.name: handleAssetsProgress -

params.name: e
params.description: - The progress event

classitems.description: debug loading of game assets
classitems.name: handleAssetsFile

params.name: e
params.description: - the file load event

classitems.description:
All game assets have completed loading, now update visible load state information
and dispatch a Signal to game and pass assets.
This is done on a setTimeout to prevent a bug probably related to too much strain on the cpu
classitems.name: handleAssetsLoaded

classitems.description:
Signal Dispatcher is the core communication component of the application.  Ensure it is passed into any Class which might need to talk to another.
In this context we can listen to gameData signals, and have the signalDispatcher dispatch a signal which can be listened to by GameComponents which require
to be notified when some server data has been received.  Eg. ReelsComponent can spin the reels when a spin response is received.
classitems.name: signalDispatcher

classitems.description:
GameData is effectively the server application model.  All data returned by the server is stored in the GameData.
GameData may also dispatch signals which we can use to provide hooks to the rest of the application via signalDispatcher.
classitems.name: gameData

classitems.description:
init method stores passed in signalDispatcher and gameData.
Signals which need to be handled by GameComponents should also be declared here.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Specific to 'gaffeing', these requests
classitems.name: requestGaffeSpin

params.name: request
params.description: the api get url

Makes a REST call to the server api requesting a random spin result.
GET: "/api/random-spin"
Returns the spinResponse in JSON when completed and passes the result to GameData
classitems.name: requestSpin

classitems.description:
Makes a REST api call to server requesting a slotInit response.
GET: "/api/slot-init"
Returns the slotInit in JSON when completed and passes the result to GameData.
classitems.name: requestInit

classitems.description: The application config file (setup.json)
classitems.name: setup

classitems.name: gaffeSelect

classitems.name: serverSpinRequested

classitems.name: spinReponseReceived

classitems.description:
Initialise the SignalDispatcher with setup object and gameComponents.
Initialise signal handlers
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Dispatched when GameData has received slotResponse. Get the ReelsComponent and spin call a reelSpin.

Dispached by ReelsComponent when the reel spin begins.
This class calls the components which require to update the display at the start of each spin, eg, clearing win animations queue and graphics.
classitems.name: handleReelSpinStart

classitems.description:
Dispatched by the GaffeMenu when a gaffe button is selected.
Sets the commandQueue gaffe type for animating the final win, and starts spinning the reels.
classitems.name: handleGaffeSelected

params.name: gaffeType
params.description: - the menu option string

todo: clean up gaffing / commandQueue mess

classitems.description: Used here to prepare and run win animations.
classitems.name: winAnimationQueue

classitems.description:
Initialise Class dependencies
Create signal handlers related to win animation
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
As soon as the spinRepsonse is returned, we are ready to queue up a win animation
The win animation itself will play on "reelSpinCompleted" signal.
The steps to queue the win animation as follows:
1. Use the spin response to test the number spinRecords received.
todo:
support multiple spin records.
2. Use the reelStrips from the slotInit and the stops from the spinResponse to take a cut of symbolIds.
This cut will contain the visible symbol indexes which the user will see when the spin has completed.
3. Get the number of visible symbolIndexes which equal the the replacement symbolIndex (defined in setup.json)
4. If this number === numReels * visible symbols per reel

then a big win anim should be queued.
5. Use the replacements array from spinResponse to decide which type of big win anim should play.
eg. on a 5 strip x 3 symbol reel then 15 replacement symbolIndexes visible on the reel means a 3x5 win animation should play
classitems.name: queueWinAnimation

classitems.description: Adds big win animation to the beginning of a win animation command queue
classitems.name: insertBigWinCommands

classitems.description:
Takes an array of frameLabels along a payline and the winningType in spinResponse
Compare the symbols along the payline match the winningType symbol id, or the wild symbol ID (hardcoded here to 0)
and return the number of winning symbols on the payline
classitems.name: getNumWinsOnPayline

params.name: winningType
params.description: - the winning type id from the spin response - eg 1 (which is an m1 symbol)

return.description: the number of winning symbols on this payline which should show animated win

classitems.description:
Dispatched by ReelsComponent when the reel spin stops.
Here we can setup any necessary win animations, and update the meter.
classitems.name: handleReeSpinComplete

classitems.description: Saves reference to Setup and GameComponents
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Generates a win animation accorind to gaffeType
classitems.name: generateGaffe

params.name: gaffeType
params.description: - the gaffe to generate a queue for

classitems.description: Initial Utils setup: for now just parse the queryString into global params object
classitems.name: Utils.init

classitems.description:
Array container for all GameComponents.
GameComponents should automatically add themselves to the gameComponents array during init (when their init super is called).
classitems.name: gameComponents

classitems.description:
Access value the app is currently scaled to.
It is modified when the app is rescaled.
classitems.name: currentScale

classitems.description: Global object to store queryString parameters
Global object to store enviroment vars passed from express
Pass the fully qualified class name of component {eg. G.ReelsComponent} to return the component instance.
classitems.name: getGameComponentByClass -

params.name: componentClass
params.description: - must be the class type of a G.GameComponent

classitems.description:
Wrapper function useful for allowing setTimeout to be used inside loops where creating new functions is inefficient
method callLater

params.name: func
params.description: - function to be called later

params.name: args
params.description: - arguments to pass to func

params.name: scope
params.description: - scope for function call (eg. pass this if required)

params.name: ms
params.description: - millis til function call (may pass 0 to delay a function call to next execution cycle)

classitems.description: Shuffles elements of an array randomly and returns the new array
classitems.name: shuffle

params.name: arr
params.description: - array to be shuffled

classitems.description: Creates a global object params based on queryString parameters.
classitems.name: parseQueryString

classitems.description: Stores a reference to G.Game, Everything a King Kong game needs is created by the game.
classitems.name: game

classitems.description:
Application entry point initialises Game.
Creates a new Game and calls game.init.
classitems.name: init

Missing item type
Preloader initialisation sets up the following:

- Set up LoadQueue for loading config file (setup.json).
- Set up LoadQueue for loading game assets (sounds, spritesheets more jsons)
- Set up EventHandlers to listen for LoadQueue events.
- Install the SoundJS Plugin
